page.title: 16CHANGING TIMES IN FLITWICK 1
page.content: {AN INTERVIEW WITH MISS WILLIAMS. ON TUESDAY 9TH JULY MISS WILLIAMS CAME INTO WOODLAND SCHOOL AND TOLD US ABOUT FLITWICK AS IT WAS.FLITWICK USED TO BE A VERY QUIET PLACE.IT WAS NEARLY ALL FIELDS AND FARMS. ON AMPTHILL ROAD IN 1910 THERE WERE ONLY TWO HOUSES,BUT OVER THE NEXT TWENTY YEARS MANY MORE WERE BUILT. AFTER EACH WORLD WAR A LARGE COUNCIL ESTATE WAS BUILT IN FLITWICK. THEN IN 1973 A NEW,LARGE,PRIVATE ESTATE WAS BEGUN ON THE WEST EDGE OF THE VILLAGE. MISS WILLIAMS WENT TO SCHOOL AT FLITWICK SCHOOL,DUNSTABLE ROAD,WHICH LATER BECAME FLITWICK LOWER SCHOOL AND MORE RECENTLY BECAME FLITWICK YOUTH CLUB.BEHIND FLITWICK SCHOOL WAS A POND,BUT NOW IT IS FILLED IN AND IT IS AN OPEN SPACE.IN THE PAST THIS AREA FLOODED FRQUENTLY AND THIS WAS KNOWN AS 'THE POND'S REVENGE ON THE COUNCIL'
